content:
• Wednesday, March 20, 2013
  • CBLI

    Cleveland BioLabs (NASDAQ:CBLI) gets a lift during the post-session after Cantor Fitzgerald...

    Cleveland BioLabs (NASDAQ:CBLI) gets a lift during the post-session after Cantor Fitzgerald initiated the shares late in the day with a Buy rating and a hefty $4 price target. Cantor says the stock has been depressed by several overhangs that have caused it to lag its peers. Once that pressure is eliminated, the shares should trade at a higher valuation more closely aligned to its peers. Shares +6.7% AH.

     
     
     
     
    | 8:01 PM
  • TUMI

    More on Tumi Holdings (NYSE:TUMI): Q4 misses on EPS estimates, despite an 18% jump in total...

    More on Tumi Holdings (NYSE:TUMI): Q4 misses on EPS estimates, despite an 18% jump in total sales. Net earnings rose 32% Y/Y as the luggage maker continued to see strong direct-sales growth in North America and internationally. Guidance for FY13 looks light however, now expecting $0.82 to $0.86 per share on around $470M to $478M. Analysts were looking for $0.88 on revenue of $474M. Shares -9% AH.
     
     
     
     
    | 7:40 PM
  • TLYS

    More on Tilly's (NYSE:TLYS): Q4 comes in mixed, beating on a per share basis but coming up...

    More on Tilly's (NYSE:TLYS): Q4 comes in mixed, beating on a per share basis but coming up slightly shy on the revenue side. Net earnings fell 29% Y/Y as the clothing retailer posted higher income tax expenses. The company guides its current quarter EPS lower, now projecting earnings of between $0.04 and $0.07 a share, below the $0.14 estimate from analysts. It also forecast a comp-store sales decline in the low to mid-single digit range, as traffic and sales were soft in the first few weeks of the period. For FY13 it expects to earn $0.75 to $0.81 a share, which also miss the $0.95 estimate anticipated by the Street. Shares -11.3% AH.

     
     
     
     
    | 7:19 PM
  • GES

    More on Guess (NYSE:GES): Q4 beats across the board, but net earnings fell 24% Y/Y as higher...

    More on Guess (NYSE:GES): Q4 beats across the board, but net earnings fell 24% Y/Y as higher input costs and special charges offset an improvement in revenue. The company also issued lower guidance for Q1, now forecasting per-share earnings of $0.05 - $0.10 cents on revenue of $545M to $560M. Analysts were looking for $0.29 and $591M, respectively. Shares -6.5% AH.

     
     
     
     
    | 6:01 PM
  • PRKR

    ParkerVision (OTC:PRKR) -7.3% AH after announcing a public stock offering of undisclosed size....

    ParkerVision (OTC:PRKR) -7.3% AH after announcing a public stock offering of undisclosed size. Investors are betting the offering price will be well below today's close. The RF chipmaker has been bleeding cash for some time. (PR)

     
     
     
     
    | 6:00 PM
  • FSYS

    After-hours top gainers, as of 5:15 p.m.: FSYS +3%. JKS +2%. HLF +2%. GEVO +2%. CIM +2%....

    After-hours top gainers, as of 5:15 p.m.: FSYS +3%. JKS +2%. HLF +2%. GEVO +2%. CIM +2%.
    After-hours top losers: GMO -16%. TLYS -10%. TUMI -10%. ORCL -7%. GES -5%.
     
     
     
     
    | 5:39 PM
  • PSUN

    More on Pacific Sunwear (NASDAQ:PSUN): Q4 comes largely in-line on revenue, but misses on a per...

    More on Pacific Sunwear (NASDAQ:PSUN): Q4 comes largely in-line on revenue, but misses on a per share basis. Net losses narrowed as the teen-focused specialty retailer posted stronger sales and margins. The company issued a downbeat view for the current quarter however, now projecting a per-share loss of $0.17 to $0.24 on revenue of $160M to $167M. Analysts were expecting a loss of $0.13 on revenue of $168M. Shares -1% AH.

     
     
     
     
    | 5:32 PM
  • GMO

    General Moly (NYSEMKT:GMO) -6.1% AH on news of the suspension of its $665M loan being negotiated...

    General Moly (NYSEMKT:GMO) -6.1% AH on news of the suspension of its $665M loan being negotiated with China Development Bank for work on its Mt. Hope molybdenum project in Nevada. The chairman of the group arranging the loan reportedly has been detained by Chinese authorities.

     
     
     
     
    | 5:13 PM | 2 Comments
  • DE

    Weakness in the U.S. ag market outlook due to weaker commodity prices in the years ahead was at...

    Weakness in the U.S. ag market outlook due to weaker commodity prices in the years ahead was at the heart of downgrades (I, II) that sent Deere (DE -3.1%) and Agco (AGCO -3.9%) lower today. Wells Fargo cut its outlook for 2014-15 U.S. large farm equipment demand as commodity prices return to normal along with growing conditions, and on moderating U.S. corn-based ethanol consumption.
     
     
     
     
    | 4:52 PM | 2 Comments
  • MLNX

    Some enterprise IT names slump in response to Oracle's FQ3 miss, which included a surprising 2%...

    Some enterprise IT names slump in response to Oracle's FQ3 miss, which included a surprising 2% Y/Y drop in new software license/cloud subscription revenue, and a 23% Y/Y drop in hardware product sales. InfiniBand hardware supplier Mellanox (NASDAQ:MLNX) is the worst-hit, -7% AH. IBM -1%. HPQ -1%. EMC -1.2%. RHT -1.9%. VMW -1%. TIBX -1.2%. TDC -1%. Archrival SAP is unchanged for now.

     
     
     
     
    | 4:44 PM
  • CIM

    As previously promised, Chimera Investment (NYSE:CIM) declares a Q1 dividend of $0.09/share,...

    As previously promised, Chimera Investment (NYSE:CIM) declares a Q1 dividend of $0.09/share, unchanged from last quarter. The company estimates economic book value of $3.04/share as of Dec. 31 vs. $2.95/share 3 months earlier. Stock is up 1% to $3.19 AH. (PR)

     
     
     
     
    | 4:27 PM
  • ISRG

    Intuitive Surgical (NASDAQ:ISRG) never batted an eye to concerns raised earlier today by...

    Intuitive Surgical (NASDAQ:ISRG) never batted an eye to concerns raised earlier today by Massachusetts health officials about injuries linked to robot surgery. In a statement on the state's Board of Registration in Medicine website, officials noted an increasing number of reports of patient complications related to the devices over the last two years. Nonetheless, the stock finished out at its high for the day, +2.6%.
     
     
     
     
    | 4:25 PM | 4 Comments
  • EHC

    HealthSouth Corp (HLS +5.1%) hit a new 52-week high of $26.40 earlier today before settling back...

    HealthSouth Corp (HLS +5.1%) hit a new 52-week high of $26.40 earlier today before settling back a bit at the close, after the company announced preliminary results of its modified Dutch auction. The rehabilitation facilities operator said that 9.12M shares were tendered at or below the $25.50 per share purchase price, reducing HLS's float by around 9.5%.

     
     
     
     
    | 4:12 PM
  • GES

    Guess? (NYSE:GES): Q4 EPS of $0.95 beats by $0.08. Revenue of $815.1M beats by $29.53M. Shares...

    Guess? (NYSE:GES): Q4 EPS of $0.95 beats by $0.08. Revenue of $815.1M beats by $29.53M. Shares -7.5% AH. (PR)
     
     
     
     
    | 4:07 PM | 3 Comments
  • JBL

    Jabil Circuit (NYSE:JBL): FQ2 EPS of $0.53 misses by $0.01. Revenue of $4.4B (+4.3% Y/Y) beats...

    Jabil Circuit (NYSE:JBL): FQ2 EPS of $0.53 misses by $0.01. Revenue of $4.4B (+4.3% Y/Y) beats by $0.02B. Shares -1.9% AH. (PR)
     
     
     
     
    | 4:04 PM
  • ORCL

    Oracle (NYSE:ORCL): FQ3 EPS of $0.65 misses by $0.01. Revenue of $9B misses by $0.4B. Shares...

    Oracle (NYSE:ORCL): FQ3 EPS of $0.65 misses by $0.01. Revenue of $9B misses by $0.4B. Shares -5.5% AH. (PR)
     
     
     
     
    | 4:02 PM | 6 Comments
  • SNCR

    Synchronoss (SNCR -1.6%) sales chief Christopher Putnam has resigned to "pursue other...

    Synchronoss (SNCR -1.6%) sales chief Christopher Putnam has resigned to "pursue other interests." The disclosure is leading shares of the mobile activation/provisioning software firm, which have rallied strongly since November, to close lower.

     
     
     
     
    | 3:54 PM
  • BAM

    GrafTech International (GTI +8.1%) moves up after an SEC filing shows that some of its...

    GrafTech International (GTI +8.1%) moves up after an SEC filing shows that some of its officials, including its CEO, Craig Shular, bought around 50K shares.
     
     
     
     
    | 3:41 PM
  • XEC

    Cimarex Energy (XEC -2.4%) is downgraded to Market Perform at FBR Capital, which says key...

    Cimarex Energy (XEC -2.4%) is downgraded to Market Perform at FBR Capital, which says key catalysts have played out. Ongoing de-risking of the horizontal Wolfcamp drilling program has begun to meaningfully expand inventory, and the NGL/gas-heavy upgraded Cana program offers a deep inventory; the firm believes these are reflected in current valuation.

     
     
     
     
    | 3:16 PM
  • CIE

    Overlooked in Cobalt Energy's (CIE +8.4%) mega-find at Shenandoah-2 was a second deepwater Gulf...

    Overlooked in Cobalt Energy's (CIE +8.4%) mega-find at Shenandoah-2 was a second deepwater Gulf of Mexico find at its 60%-owned North Platte-1 exploration well, which hit 550 net feet of oil pay in quality reservoirs vs. pre-drilling estimates of 350 net feet. But it's the Shenandoah play that's sparking a raft of price target hikes from analysts, including UBS (to $36 from $33).

     
     
     
     
    | 2:45 PM | 1 Comment
  • FRAN

    An aggressive plan by Francesca's (FRAN +6.2%) to add another 80 stores isn't getting frowned on...

    An aggressive plan by Francesca's (FRAN +6.2%) to add another 80 stores isn't getting frowned on by investors. Sitting as a bit of a hidden retail growth story, the company will soar past the 400-store count this year after only having 78 in 2007. What to watch: Something looks like it's about to give with Wall Street gushing about the retailer's strong same-store sales but short interest on FRAN marching higher.

     
     
     
     
    | 2:34 PM | 2 Comments
  • TRLG

    True Religion's (TRLG +2.4%) board is looking at options other than sale, according to...

    True Religion's (TRLG +2.4%) board is looking at options other than sale, according to dealReporter. Shares of TRLG are still up 2.4% on the day, holding must of their gains from an early morning rush following the announcement on the exit of the retailer's CEO.
     
     
     
     
    | 2:26 PM
  • IART

    Integra LifeSciences (IART -1.3%) catches a bout of volatility today, now trading down after...

    Integra LifeSciences (IART -1.3%) catches a bout of volatility today, now trading down after saying it's expanding its range of products to treat spinal deformity by adding a second cobalt chrome rod for its Daytona and Malibu Spinal systems, which provides additional strength and stiffness over the existing chrome rod. The new offering expected to have a controlled market release in Q3.

     
     
     
     
    | 2:11 PM
  • CTAS

    Cintas (CTAS -7.3%) trades lower after the company narrowly missed profit estimates with its FQ3...

    Cintas (CTAS -7.3%) trades lower after the company narrowly missed profit estimates with its FQ3 report and lowered FY13 guidance. On an earnings conference call, execs warn the pricing environment will remain highly competitive for the products and services the company offers. (transcript)

     
     
     
     
    | 1:50 PM
  • GTIV

    Gentiva Health Services (GTIV -6%) slips after issuing a dour FY13 forecast due to the negative...

    Gentiva Health Services (GTIV -6%) slips after issuing a dour FY13 forecast due to the negative effects from sequestration and Medicare-related rate changes. It now expects to earn $0.90 to $1.10 a share on revenue of $1.69B to $1.73B. Analysts were anticipating an EPS of $1.26 on revenue of $1.72B.

     
     
     
     
    | 1:46 PM
  • VIVHY

    Vivendi (OTCPK:VIVHY) is thinking of spinning off its SFR French mobile phone unit, four sources...

    Vivendi (OTCPK:VIVHY) is thinking of spinning off its SFR French mobile phone unit, four sources tell Bloomberg. One proposal involves SFR, which made up ~40% of Vivendi's 2012 sales, assuming most of the conglomerate's debt. The sources caution a split could take 3-5 years to pull off, and would likely happen following the sale of Vivendi's 53% stake in Morocco's Maroc Telecom. Vivendi closed up 4.4% in Paris on the news; SFR rival France Telecom (FTE +3.1%) spiked higher, and is seeing decent gains in the U.S.

     
     
     
     
    | 1:05 PM | 1 Comment
  • ETH

    Furniture sellers Ethan Allen (ETH +4%) and Pier 1 Imports (PIR +2.3%) are riding the coattails...

    Furniture sellers Ethan Allen (ETH +4%) and Pier 1 Imports (PIR +2.3%) are riding the coattails of a big post-earnings rally in Williams-Sonoma. The sector is gaining favor again with housing prices giving homeowners a bit of breathing room and remodels picking up.

     
     
     
     
    | 12:57 PM | 1 Comment
  • MPO

    Midstates Petroleum (MPO +2.7%) says it received a favorable ruling from the Louisiana Supreme...

    Midstates Petroleum (MPO +2.7%) says it received a favorable ruling from the Louisiana Supreme Court in litigation over working interests in the Pine Prairie field. Following MPO's acquisition of Mississippi Lime assets last year, "the exposure to potential reserve losses was smaller than a year ago, but still a positive outcome that could put [the litigation] story to bed," Wells Fargo says.

     
     
     
     
    | 12:54 PM
  • FSLR

    On a day when Suntech's creditors have filed for bankruptcy proceedings to commence, U.S. solar...

    On a day when Suntech's creditors have filed for bankruptcy proceedings to commence, U.S. solar plays First Solar (FSLR +6%), SunPower (SPWR +5.1%), and MEMC (WFR +4.3%) are up strongly. The fact the Chinese government now appears willing to let local manufacturers go under (previous) could be fueling hopes of a more stable/rational pricing environment. On the flip side, the government's plans to cut solar subsidies stand to hurt local demand.

     
     
     
     
    | 12:54 PM
  • OMPI

    Midday top 10 gainers: OMPI +28%. OTC:AFFY +18%. MTSL +13%. NPD +12%. CHYR + 12%. GEVO +12%. WSM...

    Midday top 10 gainers: OMPI +28%. OTC:AFFY +18%. MTSL +13%. NPD +12%. CHYR + 12%. GEVO +12%. WSM +11%. BIOF +10%. AIR +9%. PPHM +8%.
    Midday top 10 losers: ATOS -18%. LIVE -15%. MXWL -15%. CHKR -14%. ECT -12%. CIG -13%. SGOC -12%. FFEX -11%. ABCD -11%. OTIV -9%.
     
     
     
     
    | 12:45 PM
  • CHK

    Chesapeake's (CHK -2%) bond case will get a speedy resolution, as a judge sets an April 23 trial...

    Chesapeake's (CHK -2%) bond case will get a speedy resolution, as a judge sets an April 23 trial date to settle a dispute with bondholders over a redemption it’s attempting. CHK wants to redeem bonds set to mature in 2019 but contain a provision that allows it to redeem them at par up to March 15, 2013. One bondholder sees a slim chance for settlement at some premium over the bonds’ current trading price of 105.

     
     
     
     
    | 12:38 PM | 2 Comments
  • ICAD

    iCAD (ICAD +2.3%) FDA) gains after saying it's received FDA clearance for its new cervical...

    iCAD (ICAD +2.3%) FDA) gains after saying it's received FDA clearance for its new cervical applicator for use with its Xoft Axxent Electronic Brachytherapy System to deliver high dose rate brachytherapy for intracavitary treatment of cancer of the uterus and cervix.
     
     
     
     
    | 12:34 PM
  • BLRX

    BioLine (BLRX -51%) craters after discontinuing Phase II/III Clarity trials for its...

    BioLine (BLRX -51%) craters after discontinuing Phase II/III Clarity trials for its antipsychotic-drug BL-1020, saying it wasn't effective when compared with the antipsychotic Risperidone, its primary efficacy endpoint. The company plans to complete its analysis of the data to determine if there may be future potential for the product. As a result of the discontinuation, the company expects to incur a $6M to $7M reduction in planned R&D expenses for the rest of 2013 and part of 2014.

     
     
     
     
    | 12:10 PM
  • FNFG

    First Niagara FInancial's (FNFG +3.1%) shareholders seem pleased with the abrupt departure of...

    First Niagara FInancial's (FNFG +3.1%) shareholders seem pleased with the abrupt departure of CEO John Koelmel last night. EVP Gary Crosby has been selected as his interim replacement. Koelmel's is contactually obligated to get triple his salary plus a bonus upon departure - $5.45M. He also owns about $10M in stock. (PR)

     
     
     
     
    | 12:02 PM | 2 Comments
  • APC

    The big Shenandoah oil deposit, potentially one of the largest discoveries ever in the Gulf of...

    The big Shenandoah oil deposit, potentially one of the largest discoveries ever in the Gulf of Mexico, could contain 500M-1B boe, Citi analyst Robert Morris says in backing his Buy ratings for Anadarko (APC +3%), Cobalt (CIE +7.7%) and Marathon (MRO +0.8%). The discovery could boost APC's profits by $3-$6/share, CIE's by $2.50-$5/share and MRO's by $0.75-$1.50.

     
     
     
     
    | 11:48 AM | 9 Comments
  • FTEK

    Shares of Fuel Tech (FTEK -1.1%) rallies back to trim earlier losses of about 9% today, after...

    Shares of Fuel Tech (FTEK -1.1%) rallies back to trim earlier losses of about 9% today, after the company reported a Q4 miss late yesterday. The company reported a net loss for the quarter, compared to a gain in the prior year period, blaming its Fuel Chem business segment for the loss as it continues to face challenging low natural gas prices and reduced electricity demand.

     
     
     
     
    | 11:46 AM | 1 Comment
  • PLCM

    An upgrade to Buy from Goldman leads Polycom (PLCM +6.5%) to jump. The firm thinks the...

    An upgrade to Buy from Goldman leads Polycom (PLCM +6.5%) to jump. The firm thinks the struggling videoconferencing hardware firm's revenue and margins are at an inflection point. Polycom is betting on its software-based CloudAxis platform to help fuel a turnaround.
     
     
     
     
    | 11:36 AM
  • MJNA

    Medical Marijuana (OTCPK:MJNA +6.3%) trades higher after announcing it will begin selling its...

    Medical Marijuana (OTCPK:MJNA +6.3%) trades higher after announcing it will begin selling its products and services in Europe, Canada, and the Caribbean. The company adds it plans to invest in local manufacturers and distributors, and hopes to bring over-the-counter products to the aforementioned markets. (PR)

     
     
     
     
    | 11:20 AM | 15 Comments
  • BMRN

    BioMarin Pharmaceutical (BMRN +0.7%) says results from Phase 1/2 trials for BMN-701, a treatment...

    BioMarin Pharmaceutical (BMRN +0.7%) says results from Phase 1/2 trials for BMN-701, a treatment of late-onset Pompe disease, exceeded requirements for proceeding to the next phase of development. Pompe disease is a rare, inherited and often fatal disorder that disables the heart and skeletal muscles. The company plans to move on to Phase 2/3 trials for the treatment by the end of this year.

     
     
     
     
    | 11:15 AM
  • MTSL

    MER Telemanagement Solutions (MTSL +11.2%) recaptures a chunk of yesterday's 36% post-earnings...

    MER Telemanagement Solutions (MTSL +11.2%) recaptures a chunk of yesterday's 36% post-earnings dive as SA author super-trades says the market is overreacting to news the company's largest customer will not re-up in 2014. MER, he says, has avenues to replace that revenue, and - even if it doesn't - the shares are reasonably priced.

     
     
     
     
    | 11:12 AM
  • XNPT

    Wells Fargo's Brian Abrahams is defending XenoPort (XNPT -2.6%) this morning on the back of...

    Wells Fargo's Brian Abrahams is defending XenoPort (XNPT -2.6%) this morning on the back of competitor Biogen's (BIIB +1.5%) positive trial results for its MS treatment Plegridy. He says that, despite the competition, BIIB's multiple sclerosis pill patents should be a positive for XNPT. Most notably, additional patent applications could provide patent protection until 2032 for BIIB's BG-12, which should benefit XNPT's '829 drug, an earlier stage derivative of BG-12, and give it added protection from generic competition.

     
     
     
     
    | 10:59 AM
  • FDO

    A number of discounter stocks are catching a tailwind today as investors seem to be shifting...

    A number of discounter stocks are catching a tailwind today as investors seem to be shifting their attitudes toward the outlook for discretionary spending or shifting from topped-out sectors. Advancers include the dollar store group - Family Dollar Stores (FDO +2.9%), Dollar General (DG +2.5%), and Dollar Tree (DLTR +2.9%) - while Five Below (FIVE +1.3%) and Fred's (FRED +2%) are also outperforming. Even retail giants Target (TGT +1.5%) and Wal-Mart (WMT +0.7%) aren't getting left behind.
     
     
     
     
    | 10:57 AM
  • TCEHY

    Solid earnings from Tencent (OTCPK:TCEHY) and a rally in Shanghai help Chinese Internet stocks...

    Solid earnings from Tencent (OTCPK:TCEHY) and a rally in Shanghai help Chinese Internet stocks trade higher. YOKU +3.8%. SINA +2.8%. QIHU +2.5%. SOHU +1.8%. YY +1.8%. NTES +1.5%. PWRD +1.7%. Tencent, which rose 1.5% in Hong Kong, reported a 53% Y/Y increase in Q4 sales to $1.96B, and a 37% increase in net income to $557M. Ad sales were better than expected, and value-added service sales (includes online games) rose 32%. Registered accounts for Tencent's WeChat mobile IM platform, which competes with Sina's Weibo, have topped 300M.
     
     
     
     
    | 10:57 AM
  • CIG

    Cia. Energetica de Minas Gerais (CIG -12.2%) and shares of other Brazilian utilities are under...

    Cia. Energetica de Minas Gerais (CIG -12.2%) and shares of other Brazilian utilities are under pressure on expectations for Brazil's regulator to curb electricity rate increases Cemig had planned to put in place in April. Shares also were downgraded yesterday at Standpoint Research. Also: ELP -3.7%, CPL -3.4%, EBR -2.4%.

     
     
     
     
    | 10:43 AM | 1 Comment
  • EDU

    New Oriental Education (EDU -3.6%) denies rumors saying the company is close to going down the...

    New Oriental Education (EDU -3.6%) denies rumors saying the company is close to going down the path to be taken private. Reports of talks between Alibaba and New Oriental put a charge into shares earlier this week.

     
     
     
     
    | 10:36 AM
  • WSM

    Shares of Williams-Sonoma (WSM +9%) jet higher after the retailer reported a...

    Shares of Williams-Sonoma (WSM +9%) jet higher after the retailer reported a better-than-anticipated Q4 profit. A 3-year $750M buyback plan launched by the company and another strong quarter for its online business are also helping to tip sentiment.

     
     
     
     
    | 10:23 AM
  • CSII

    Cardiovascular Systems (CSII +4%) gains this morning after pricing its 2M secondary offering at...

    Cardiovascular Systems (CSII +4%) gains this morning after pricing its 2M secondary offering at $17.60, just a mere a 1% discount to Tuesday's close. The medical device company, says it wants to use the proceeds for working capital and general corporate needs - which likely includes further funding of its Orbit II trials, a treatment therapy for severely calcified coronary lesions. The company's current float is around 21.1M shares.

     
     
     
     
    | 10:21 AM
  • IVAN

    Ivanhoe Energy (IVAN +13.8%) and SBM Offshore form a global strategic alliance, combining their...

    Ivanhoe Energy (IVAN +13.8%) and SBM Offshore form a global strategic alliance, combining their respective expertise to produce a design for offshore facilities that will economically produce and upgrade heavy oil from offshore fields with crude oil quality down to 10 API gravity.

     
     
     
     
    | 10:05 AM | 4 Comments
  • SPRD

    Another day, another upgrade for Spreadtrum (SPRD +4.5%). Jefferies' Ken Hui, who is lifting...

    Another day, another upgrade for Spreadtrum (SPRD +4.5%). Jefferies' Ken Hui, who is lifting shares to Buy, observes China Mobile's (NYSE:CHL) strong TD-SCDMA 3G sub growth is increasing the market for Spreadtrum's baseband chips, and that prices have stabilized thanks to supply constraints. The firm now sees China Mobile posting 2013 TD-SCDMA net adds of 74.4M and phone shipments of 139M (+88%). Such growth is also a positive for Marvell (NASDAQ:MRVL) and Qualcomm (NASDAQ:QCOM). (Chardan Capital upgrade)

     
     
     
     
    | 10:00 AM | 1 Comment
  • MODN

    Model N (NYSE:MODN), a provider of revenue management software for life sciences, soars 37% to...

    Model N (NYSE:MODN), a provider of revenue management software for life sciences, soars 37% to $21.25 as it makes its debut on the NYSE after pricing its IPO at $15.50, above the expected range of $12.50-14.50. Model N raised $104M by selling 6.7M shares, giving it a starting market cap of $384M.

     
     
     
     
    | 9:59 AM
  • BBY

    Why all the analyst love for Best Buy (BBY +2.5%)? Shares of the retailer have almost doubled...

    Why all the analyst love for Best Buy (BBY +2.5%)? Shares of the retailer have almost doubled since the start of the year as one investment after another turns bullish (Credit Suisse, JPMorgan, Goldman Sachs). The common theme is that a strong management team can lead another round of cost cutting and squeeze more profits out of online and mobile channels.

     
     
     
     
    | 9:50 AM | 2 Comments
  • FNV

    Franco Nevada (FNV -4.1%) opens sharply lower after reporting late yesterday that adjusted...

    Franco Nevada (FNV -4.1%) opens sharply lower after reporting late yesterday that adjusted earnings rose a penny to $0.32/share in Q4 and revenues fell 3.7% Y/Y to $114M; both figures fell short of analyst consensus. Expects to receive 215K-235K gold equivalent oz. from its mineral assets vs. ~230K gold equivalent ounces in 2012.

     
     
     
     
    | 9:43 AM
  • ZNGA

    BofA/Merrill sees "less valuation upside" for Zynga (ZNGA -4%) following a 47% YTD gain, and has...

    BofA/Merrill sees "less valuation upside" for Zynga (ZNGA -4%) following a 47% YTD gain, and has cut shares to Neutral. Shares now reflect the long-term potential value of Zynga's core franchises, says analyst Justin Post, and "competitive real-money poker launches and summer seasonality on core businesses could limit further enthusiasm." BofA upgraded Zynga on Feb. 5, just ahead of a well-received Q4 report.
     
     
     
     
    | 9:40 AM | 12 Comments
  • BB

    BlackBerry (BBRY) +5.8% on a two-notch upgrade to Overweight from Morgan Stanley's Ehud Gelblum....

    BlackBerry (BBRY) +5.8% on a two-notch upgrade to Overweight from Morgan Stanley's Ehud Gelblum. Gelblum, who had cut shares to Underweight in June when they were trading at $9.86, sees BB10 lifting ASPs and margins even as services attach rates slump He also sees a future for BB10 in the mid-range and raises the possibility of a partnership with Samsung or LG, but considers it unlikely the OS will become the world's #3 smartphone platform. FQ4 results are due in 8 days.

    More on FedEx's (NYSE:FDX) FQ3: A "very challenging" quarter was impacted by weakness in air freight markets and yield pressure due to industry overcapacity. International revenue came in $100M below guidance as customers opted for lower-yielding services. A focus moving forward will be to replace older less-efficient aircraft and manage traffic flow in Asia to boost profitability. The company sees Q4 EPS of $1.90-$2.10 vs. $2.13 consensus and $6.00-$6.20 vs. $6.35 consensus for FY13. A 10M share buyback is approved. FDX -3.2% premarket. (PR)
